Table of contents » Commands for setting up measurements/Observables

ProteinRMSD : RMSD of arbitrary type.

Available options

  • struc1: struc1 abcd.pdb:5:A,28,59
    Reference structure taken from the PDB file abcd.pdb, model 5, chain A, residues index labels 28 through 59 in that file. The file name abcd.pdb can be replaced by the $ sign, to mean that the comparison structure is a live state of the Population in the
  • struc2: struc2 efgh.pdb:5:A,28,59
    The second structure for the comparison. The filename can be replaced by the $ sign, to mean that the comparison structure is a live state of the Population in the simulation.
  • using: using +@C-BB
    Sets the filter to choose atoms for RMSD evaluations based on their properties. See ProFASi PDB handling: Selections and Filters for details.
  • no_align: no_align; A one word command that suppresses any attempt to align the sequences. The user is then responsible for all about lining up the two sequences.
  • alt_crd: alt_crd occupancy
    In case an alternative atom entries are found in a pdb file, this command sets the policy to be adopted. The value "occupancy" ensures the line with the highest occupancy value is used. Other possible policies are "first" and "last".
  • gradient_method: gradient_method 0
    To force the use of the slower trivial method to calculate gradients: evaluate each partial derivative by changing a DOF, reconstructing the population and calculating RMSD over and over again. The default method uses Jacobians and is faster. This option is only useful for debugging. Any value other than 2 is interpreted as a choice to use the slower gradient.
    See also:
    prf::ProteinRMSD
